questions.question: DGPS uses a network of___________________ to broadcast the difference between the positions indicated by the GPS satellite system and known fixed positions
What is the significance of the elevation mask in the DGPS survey? State the incorrect option

answers.a: It sets an elevation angle in the receiver below which the receiver will not track GNSS signals
answers.b: It filters out signals from satellites below a certain angle of elevation above the horizon, to prevent them from using noisy signals
answers.c: It makes the DGPS receiver exclude the satellites that are low on the horizon from the position calculation
answers.d: It makes the GPS receiver exclude the satellites that are low on the horizon from the position calculation

questions.question: In the RTK method, the base is placed over an unknown point.(say true or false)
Which one of the following places do not have a fixed ground-based reference station in India?
Which one of the following statements is false in the case of DGPS survey requirements?

answers.a: A clear view of the sky is necessary
answers.b: There is no need to be provided with the known coordinates of a point in an area to start the survey initially
answers.c: Line of sight with the base is necessary
